snippet: A push for mergers among large insurers has gained momentum since the Supreme Court upheld a key part of the Obama administration’s health care law.
abstract: Aetna nears agreement to purchase rival Humana for about $34 billion in deal that is said to presage further consolidation among nation's biggest health insurers; would pay roughly $230 per share, nearly 29 percent premium over share price before deal talks emerged.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

lead_paragraph: A push for mergers among large insurers has gained momentum since the Supreme Court upheld a key part of the Obama administration’s health care law.

headline.main: Aetna Said to Be Near Deal to Buy Humana for $34 Billion
headline.print_headline: Aetna Deal for Humana Is Expected
